CatDescriptText: Lillian Krole, waitress, North Side and Earlene Adair, student, Homewood, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, September 10, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you read daily and weekly newspapers and magazines regularly?  Do you think they present the news, etc., fairly and objectively, or do you believe that they are influenced in their presentation? If you believe the latter, who or what do you think influences the presentation?"  Ms. Krole's answer reads: "Yes, from what I've read, I think they are fair in the presentations."  Ms. Adair's answer reads: "I would say they are quite fair most of the time.  Sometimes there are errors, but I don't think they are deliberate."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Lillian Krole wearing light colored dress, standing on Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Earlene Adair wearing sleeveless shirt with rounded collar, standing on Smithfield Street, Downtown
